result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl G Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.

Seek and maintain full-time employment or school enrollment.
Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No contact with the victim.
No contact with the co-actor, Jamero Thomas.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: STAYED until 06-15-2015 at 12:00 pm.  Court allows release privileges for employment and school purposes only.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Atty. Victoria McCandless on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Carl G Thomas in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's grandmother, Andrea T. and defendant's friend, Larenze H.

AS TO COUNT 3:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3-1/2 YEARS, consecutive to case# 14CF3649.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1-1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS. 
Credit given for 40 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 3): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 75 DAYS "condition time" - STAYED until 06-15-2015 at 12:00 pm.  Court allows release privileges for employment and school purposes only.
* No contact with the victim.
* No contact with the co-actor, Jamero Thomas.
* Seek and maintain full-time employment or school enrollment.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Sentencing Referral Form.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Form.
(2) Defendant's Character Witness Letters.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint VIOLATION REPORT (missed telephone contact 5-19-15), filed.
*court to address on 6-08-15*

Defendant Carl G Thomas in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  James C. Griffin appeared for Catelin Ringersma for the State of Wisconsin.   

AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Firearms warnings given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Case will be adjourned for Sentencing before Branch 2 with the acceptance of this case.

AS TO COUNT 4:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM013444  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-11-15
Court will have a lengthy competency hearing on 02-27-2015. Court adjourned the Scheduling Conference to 04-23-2015 08:30 am in Branch 26.

Defendant Carl G Thomas in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Carl G Thomas in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is reassigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26 due to a lower pending case.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jamero Thomas or Joseph F.

Defendant Carl G Thomas in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Carl G Thomas in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
